subject: Technology
title: Growing Food in Space
description: A fast breakdown of Growing Food in Space for builders.

hook.text: On a trip to Mars, you can't order pizza delivery. Astronauts will need to grow their own food.

buildup.text: The ISS has a small garden called Veggie where astronauts grow lettuce and radishes under LED lights.

discovery.text: Plants grow without soil in space, using a technique called hydroponics with nutrient-rich water.

twist.text: Roots don't know which way is down in microgravity. Scientists had to teach plants to grow using light cues.

climax.text: Space farming is essential for long missions. Carrying all the food for a Mars trip would be impossibly heavy.

punchline.text: To reach Mars, we first need to learn to farm in space.

quiz.question: Why is space farming important for Mars missions?
options: Carrying all the food needed would be impossibly heavy
